result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter re: defendant using a false address

ADDRESS INFO for Tivon Diego-Jamal Wells
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2022)
Prior: 917 Hancock St, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 10-03-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 09-23-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 8 cts. felony bail jumping, operate motor vehicle without owner's consent-passenger, and bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,800.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with Taneekja Wellner and Antonio Wells, and defendant is to have no contact with B.J.S., DOB: 07-31-2002.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-23-2022
